$window
***REMOVED*** in module ng

Description

A reference to the browser's window object. While window is globally available in JavaScript, it causes testability problems, because it is a global variable. In angular we always refer to it through the $window ***REMOVED***, so it may be overridden, removed or mocked for testing.

Expressions, like the one defined for the ngClick directive in the example below, are evaluated with respect to the current scope. Therefore, there is no risk of inadvertently coding in a dependency on a global value in such an expression.
